page.title: 06Sunnyside House
page.content: Sunnyside is a huge house in Mayfield which was built for the Simpson family in 1872, at that time they owned the local mill. It was sold in the 1930s.for $1,000 and was turned into flats and a guest house. Most of the landscaped grounds were sold in the 1950s but it was not until the 1970s that building permission was granted for private housing to be erected on this land. So far 26 houses and bungalows have been built in a variety of architect designed styles. They sell at the moment for between $60,000 and $70,000. The original trees still remain. There is a Weeping Beech, a Redwood Cedar ,of Lebanon, several Chestnuts and Holm Oaks.
